page.name: Example of Barriers in the Environment​
page.content:
“When a flower doesn't bloom, you fix the environment in which it grows, not the flower.” 

This idea, from Alexander den Heijer, is simple but powerful. In order to design for all adult learners, we need to understand that just like flowers need different soil nutrients and amounts of water, human beings are variable in their learning needs. Therefore, the problem is not the learner, but the environment in which the learner operates (Meyer et al., 2014). ​

Variability is not just an important consideration for thinking about differences between students, but also within each student in different contexts.​

    Try it Yourself: Learn more about variability.
